alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 11:12AM CDT until May 17 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 131.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to above flood stage (138.0 feet) late tomorrow morning and to 141.9 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 138.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 141.8 feet on 03/30/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lake Creek Sendera Ranch Roa 138.0 131.5 Sun 10 am CD 138.5 140.3 137.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT.
